pullrequest.title: Disable tests compilation by default. New 'make tests' target.

content.raw:
You can create the option yourself and make it false by default (to achieve the "don't pay for it if you don't use it" goal). And only conditionally include / use `CTest`.

I think the goal of disabling `BUILD_TESTING` at configure time is that you *don't* configure the test targets. So then you can't call the test targets with make.

The opposite (always configure the tests but don't build them by default) is already achieved with using `EXCLUDE_FROM_ALL` on the test targets.
content.html:
You can create the option yourself and make it false by default (to achieve the "don't pay for it if you don't use it" goal). And only conditionally include / use CTest.

I think the goal of disabling BUILD_TESTING at configure time is that you don't configure the test targets. So then you can't call the test targets with make.

The opposite (always configure the tests but don't build them by default) is already achieved with using EXCLUDE_FROM_ALL on the test targets.
